document.docAuthor: Liu, Zhen, He, Jun-Hua, Chen, Xue-Xin & Gupta, Ankita
document.masterDocTitle: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

bibRefCitation.author: Chen, J. H. & Song, D. B.
bibRefCitation.refString: Chen, J. H. & Song, D. B. (2004) Systematic studies on Microgastrinae of China (Hymenoptera: Braconidae). Fujian Scientific Publisher, Fuzhow, 354 pp. [in Chinese with English summary]

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Apanteles longirostris
Chen & Song, 2004: 66
. Holotype ♀ — Fujian , China [FAFU].

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Body length 2.0 mm, fore wing length 2.8 mm . Body black, hind femur blackish. Ocelli small, posterior tangent to anterior ocellus hardly touching posterior ocelli, distance between fore and hind ocellus as long as diameter of hind ocellus. Antenna about as long as body length, penultimate flagellomere 1.4× longer than wide. Interspaces between punctures on disc of mesonotum slightly shorter than its diameter. Areola on propodeum closed, V-shaped apically, with strong costulae, posterio-lateral parts unsculptured except some carinae. Pterostigma 2.4× as long as its widest part, vein 1-R1 1.2× longer than pterostigma, vein r 2.1× longer than vein 2-SR, curved at junction. T1 nearly parallel-sided, 3.0× longer than hind width, turned-over part slightly shiny, strongly rugose-punctate, longitudinal channel shallow; T2 shiny and nearly polished, except a few weak punctures laterally, 3.0× wider than long in the middle; T3 3.4× longer than T2. Ovipositor sheath slightly longer than hind tibia.

Distribution. China ( Fujian , Guangdong , Guizhou , Hainan , Yunnan , Zhejiang ).
Remarks. Characters of the examined specimens mostly agree with the published descriptions except scutellar sulcus at least with 10 carinae in between and hind femur yellowish brown to black.
